review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 16, 2022
name: Heather Phillips
title: Educational, entertaining, interactive, fun,
text: Needed something for my grandson while he was recovering from surgery for an unknown amount of time at the time. I was trying to find something that he could play with that wouldn't get lost or go all over the place while he could remain fairly stationary while he was in the boundaries of his bed. It worked out really well and he had lots of fun and continues to do so. Great product.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 13, 2022
name: Meaghan M.
title: Almost perfect
text: I bought this before a long international trip as in-flight entertainment for my almost two year old.Pros- it’s super fun to use. I even love doing it. My son was able to figure it out right away and also really enjoyed it. There’s ZERO chance of making a mess or losing pieces so it’s great for the car or a plane.Cons- slightly noisy though I don’t mind. Main issue, and reason I said ALMOST perfect is that some of the holes are just slightly smaller and the metal balls fall down as soon as you pull them up. Not a huge issue given the price but if I had bought this as a mindfulness exercise for myself I’d also have to work on my patience and acceptance 😆Overall worth the money especially for travel

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 8, 2022

name: Leanne M.
title: It’s not an even number of holes.
text: So hubby bought this for me for calming when fidget toys aren’t working (Panic attacks). It works great. It is loud which actually helps.The *ONLY* complaint - it’s 19 holes x 20 holes… so I can’t do any perfect patterns. I mean it works because I can’t get anything to be perfect other than little things so I keep working at it. But ohhhhh that’s stressful.It would get 5 stars if it wasn’t for that. And yes it is aimed at kids not adults but it works…. Just don’t count them lol.

title: Therapeutic Creativeness
text: The media could not be loaded. The pen snaps in securely so I'm not worried about it getting lost. The magnets easily fill the holes and are able to be "punched" back by fingers, the "eraser" part of the writing tool, or by turning it sideways to clear many at once.It comes with a picture of many different designs you can create in case you are short on creativity at the moment.All family members enjoy using this, regardless of age.

name: Kethrim
title: Add a string to the pen and it's fantastic!
text: My students love using this board! I made a few modifications. I opened up the board to attach a cord through the holes and tied and glued the other end to the pen so that it wouldn't get lost. I also cut a piece of felt to go under the ball bearings so that it's not as loud if/when the kids shake it. If the pen came securely attached to the board, this would be a five-star review because otherwise, the board is great!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2022
name: loveadict44
title: Fun but LOUD.
text: So, my kid likes it. But I ultimately bought it to add to my arsenal of “busy toys” for when she has to sit through her brother’s PT appointments since I have to bring her along with us. The problem that I did not anticipate is that this toy is VERY loud and isn’t conducive to a quiet dr’s office. The magnetic beads inside rattle loudly when shifted, but it also makes very noisy clacking sounds when the magnetic bead is drawn up or pushed back down. It is actually astounding how loud it can be. I expected maybe a small amount of noise but it’s quite amplified. There’s just no way to prevent it. I had no idea it was going to be as noisy as it is, or I wouldn’t have bought it.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2022
name: Amazon Customer
title: Great to keep kids entertained
text: We have loved this! We have it in our sensory backpack for when we go out and my oldest loves this thing! This is her go-to when we are at restaurants waiting for our food. Normally outings would be filled with trying to come up with new creative games to pass the time and keep them entertained while we waited for our food to come out and not be overwhelmed by all the sounds and action going on around us, now we pull this out and it’s quiet and calm and peaceful. They have something to focus on to help drown all the extra sensory input and it’s been a game changer with our outings.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on June 9, 2022
name: Careshmeh
title: LOVES THIS ITEM! Used a drill…
text: I have a 6 year old and a two year old and they LOVE these! However, I bought them to take on a trip and knew the pens would get lost immediately… so I used a 3/32 drill bit and put a hole through middle section of the magnet pens, and on each board. I then opened the back with a screwdriver and tied one end inside, closed it, and tied the pen to the other end! The pens fit snugly, so I couldn’t just tie something and glue around it. I ran a nylon thread through the middle holes.VWALLA! The pens will not get lost on this mama!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 27, 2022
name: Lyudmila

So it’s still fun and entertaining but they don’t play with it as long as they did the other one because of the weaker magnets

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 27, 2022
name: Time2fish
title: Best toy ever!
text: This thing is perfect my son with special needs. He puts everything in his mouth, eats every marker and crayon no matter how hard I try to stop him, but he loves to color. This board lets him draw and has a bonus! He LOVES to push down all of the little beads, it’s perfect for sensory needs and he likes to shake it for auditory sensory input. He plays with every day, very roughly, and it’s still standing. It’s a win in my book!

title: It could be a great toy…but possible choking hazard.
text: I ordered this well in advance of my granddaughter’s 3rd birthday.The return period is very short, so we missed the cutoff because of my early purchase.My granddaughter enjoyed playing with it, but it’s missing one of the metal balls inside.She has a baby sister, so their mother is justifiably concerned that other balls could slip out and become a choking hazard.Because the return date is past, I can’t return it.And I don’t see a way to contact this seller.This is a shame, because the toy held her interest for a good thirty minutes.

name: DDC
title: Fun toy!
text: This is a really fun toy— great for many different ages because the magnetic balls stay internally in the holes. It isn’t so much a game— more like a fidget toy.It is fun to make shapes and patterns with the magnets.It is a little loud.Not loud for home use, but wouldn’t be appropriate in a classroom or church— too loud for those places.I am a psychologist and I keep one in my office for kids and adults alike to fidget, and they all love it!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 17, 2020
name: Heather D. Couillard
title: Cool!
text: This is a fun, if limited toy! Got it for my 3.5yo, but my husband and I have been enjoying it, as well - there's something very relaxing about both pulling up the metal balls, and popping them back down. And sitting and making random designs is somewhat meditative.My only real grip is that I wish we'd gotten the black one, as the designs would stand out better than they do against the blue.
